metadata.title: CVE-2025-21641 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mptcp: sysctl: blackhole timeout: avoid using current->nsproxyAs mentioned in the previous commit, using the 'net' structure via'current' is not recommended for different reasons:- Inconsistency: getting info from the reader's/writer's netns vs only  from the opener's netns.- current->nsproxy can be NULL in some cases, resulting in an 'Oops'  (null-ptr-deref), e.g. when the current task is exiting, as spotted by  syzbot [1] using acct(2).The 'pernet' structure can be obtained from the table->data usingcontainer_of().

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
